lessons: The Cher, Pandya and Chola dynasties

questions.question: Which three dynasties of South India are mentioned in ancient literature?
questions.answer: Cher, Pandya and Chola

questions.question: Which literary source mentions the Cher, Pandya and Chola dynasties?
questions.answer: Sangham Literature

questions.question: Which port of the Cher kingdom is mentioned in the Periplus of the Erythrean Sea?
questions.answer: Muziris

questions.question: What was the capital of the Pandya kingdom?
questions.answer: Madurai

questions.question: Which commodity from the Pandya kingdom was highly valued?
questions.answer: Pearls

questions.question: Which region was occupied by the ancient Chola kingdom?
questions.answer: Tiruchirapalli region

questions.question: Which dynasty established its capital at Pratishthan (Paithan)?
questions.answer: Satavahana

questions.question: Who was the founder of the Satavahana dynasty?
questions.answer: Simuk

questions.question: Which Satavahana ruler defeated the Shaka king Nahpana?
questions.answer: Gautamiputra Satakarni

questions.question: What does the title ‘Tri-samudra-toya-peet-vahan’ signify?

options.text: One whose horses drank water of three seas

questions.answer: One whose horses drank water of three seas

questions.question: Which three seas are referred to in the title Tri-samudra-toya-peet-vahan?

options.text: Arabian Sea, Red Sea, Caspian Sea
Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal, Indian Ocean
Bay of Bengal, Red Sea, Persian Gulf
Indian Ocean, Pacific Ocean, Atlantic Ocean

questions.answer: Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal, Indian Ocean

questions.question: Which Satavahana king composed ‘Gatha-Saptashati’?
questions.answer: Hala

questions.question: Which language was used to compose ‘Gatha-Saptashati’?
questions.answer: Maharashtri Prakrit

questions.question: Which pass served as an important trade route during the Satavahana period?
questions.answer: Naneghat

questions.question: Which feature appears on some Satavahana coins?
questions.answer: Ship

questions.question: Which dynasty succeeded the weakening Satavahanas?
questions.answer: Vakataka

questions.question: Who founded the Vakataka dynasty?
questions.answer: Vindhyashakti

questions.question: What was the capital of one branch of the Vakataka dynasty?
questions.answer: Nandivardhan

questions.question: Which place was known as ‘Kuntal’ in ancient times?
questions.answer: Kolhapur

questions.question: Which Vakataka ruler beautified the Ajanta caves with paintings?
questions.answer: Harishena

questions.question: Which dynasty established its capital at Badami (Vatapi)?
questions.answer: Chalukya

questions.question: Who established the Chalukya rule in the sixth century CE?
questions.answer: Pulakeshi I

questions.question: Which Chalukya ruler repulsed Harshavardhan’s invasion?
questions.answer: Pulakeshi II

questions.question: Which site is associated with Chalukya temple architecture?
questions.answer: Pattadakal

questions.question: Which dynasty ruled from Kanchipuram?
questions.answer: Pallava

questions.question: Which Pallava ruler was also a playwright?
questions.answer: Mahendravarman

questions.question: Which Pallava ruler defeated Pulakeshi II?
questions.answer: Narasimhavarman

questions.question: The ratha temples of Mahabalipuram are carved from:
questions.answer: Single rock

questions.question: Which dynasty maintained a strong navy and overseas trade?
questions.answer: Pallava

questions.question: Which traveller recorded tolerant administration under the Pallavas?
questions.answer: Yuan Chwang

questions.question: Which dynasty’s rule extended from Vindhya mountains to Kanniyakumari?
questions.answer: Rashtrakuta

questions.question: Who established Rashtrakuta power in Maharashtra?
questions.answer: Dantidurg

questions.question: Which ruler carved the Kailas temple at Ellora?
questions.answer: Krishna Raja I

questions.question: The Kailas temple is located at:
questions.answer: Ellora

questions.question: Which work provides information about Indian coastal trade?
questions.answer: Periplus of the Erythrean Sea

questions.question: Which ancient port mentioned in the Periplus no longer exists?
questions.answer: Muziris

questions.question: Which dynasty is associated with the caves of Ajanta?
questions.answer: Vakataka

questions.question: Which Prakrit work was written by Pravarsen II?
questions.answer: Setubandh

questions.question: Which poet’s Meghadoot belongs to the Vakataka period?
questions.answer: Kalidasa

questions.question: Which place served as a Pallava centre of art and architecture?
questions.answer: Mahabalipuram

questions.question: Which dynasty promoted maritime trade with Southeast Asia?
questions.answer: Pallava

questions.question: Which dynasty is known for rock-cut monolithic temples?
questions.answer: Rashtrakuta

questions.question: Which dynasty dominated Karnataka after the Vakatakas?
questions.answer: Chalukya

questions.question: Which Chalukya site is famous for early temple experiments?
questions.answer: Aihole

questions.question: Which dynasty is associated with Pattadakal as a UNESCO heritage site?
questions.answer: Chalukya

questions.question: Which dynasty ruled both northern and southern parts of India extensively?
questions.answer: Rashtrakuta

questions.question: Which dynasty is known for tolerance towards all religions?
questions.answer: Pallava

questions.question: Which dynasty is linked with extensive cave architecture in Maharashtra?
questions.answer: Satavahana

questions.question: Which dynasty is the last discussed in this chapter?
questions.answer: Rashtrakuta

questions.question: What is the central focus of this chapter?
questions.answer: Ancient kingdoms of South India

questions.question: Why are the Cher, Pandya and Chola dynasties known as ancient Tamil kingdoms?
questions.answer: They ruled Tamil-speaking regions and are described in Sangham literature.

questions.question: What is the historical importance of Sangham literature?
questions.answer: It provides information about early South Indian kingdoms, society, and economy.

questions.question: Why was Muziris an important port during ancient times?
questions.answer: It served as a major center for overseas trade.

questions.question: What made Madurai a significant city in the Pandya kingdom?
questions.answer: It was the capital and a center of culture and administration.

questions.question: Why were pearls an important economic resource for the Pandyas?
questions.answer: Pearl fishing brought wealth through trade.

questions.question: Which region did the early Cholas control?
questions.answer: They controlled the Tiruchirapalli region.

questions.question: Why is Pratishthan associated with the Satavahanas?
questions.answer: It served as their capital city.

questions.question: Who founded the Satavahana dynasty?
questions.answer: The dynasty was founded by Simuk.

questions.question: Why is Gautamiputra Satakarni considered a powerful Satavahana ruler?
questions.answer: He defeated the Shaka ruler Nahpana and expanded the kingdom.

questions.question: What does the title Tri-samudra-toya-peet-vahan indicate?
questions.answer: It indicates expansion up to three seas.

questions.question: Which three seas are associated with Satavahana expansion?
questions.answer: Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal, and Indian Ocean.

questions.question: Who composed the work Gatha-Saptashati?
questions.answer: It was composed by King Hala.

questions.question: Why is Maharashtri Prakrit important in Satavahana history?
questions.answer: It was used as a literary language during their rule.

questions.question: How did Naneghat support Satavahana trade?
questions.answer: It functioned as an important mountain pass for trade routes.

questions.question: What does the ship symbol on Satavahana coins represent?
questions.answer: It represents maritime trade.

questions.question: Which dynasty rose after the decline of the Satavahanas?
questions.answer: The Vakataka dynasty rose after the Satavahanas.

questions.question: Who founded the Vakataka dynasty?
questions.answer: The dynasty was founded by Vindhyashakti.

questions.question: Why is Nandivardhan important in Vakataka history?
questions.answer: It served as the capital of a Vakataka branch.

questions.question: What artistic achievement is associated with Harishena?
questions.answer: He patronized the paintings of Ajanta caves.

questions.question: Why is Kolhapur mentioned in Vakataka history?
questions.answer: It was known as Kuntal in ancient times.

questions.question: Which dynasty established its capital at Vatapi?
questions.answer: The Chalukya dynasty established its capital at Vatapi.

questions.question: Who laid the foundation of Chalukya power?
questions.answer: Pulakeshi I laid the foundation of Chalukya power.

questions.question: Why is Pulakeshi II remembered in history?
questions.answer: He successfully resisted Harshavardhan’s invasion.

questions.question: What architectural importance does Pattadakal hold?
questions.answer: It showcases Chalukya temple architecture.

questions.question: Which dynasty ruled from Kanchipuram?
questions.answer: The Pallava dynasty ruled from Kanchipuram.

questions.question: Why is Mahendravarman significant among Pallava rulers?
questions.answer: He was a ruler and a playwright.

questions.question: Who defeated Pulakeshi II in battle?
questions.answer: Narasimhavarman defeated Pulakeshi II.

questions.question: What makes the ratha temples of Mahabalipuram unique?
questions.answer: They are carved from a single rock.

questions.question: Why were the Pallavas known for naval strength?
questions.answer: They promoted overseas trade.

questions.question: Which traveller commented on Pallava administration?
questions.answer: The Chinese traveller Yuan Chwang.

questions.question: Which dynasty expanded rule from the Vindhyas to Kanniyakumari?
questions.answer: The Rashtrakuta dynasty expanded rule over this region.

questions.question: Who founded the Rashtrakuta power?
questions.answer: Rashtrakuta power was founded by Dantidurg.

questions.question: Why is Krishna Raja I important in Rashtrakuta history?
questions.answer: He built the Kailas temple at Ellora.

questions.question: What architectural feature distinguishes the Kailas temple?
questions.answer: It is a monolithic rock-cut temple.

questions.question: Which ancient text provides details about coastal trade?
questions.answer: The Periplus of the Erythrean Sea.

questions.question: Why is Muziris considered historically important despite no longer existing?
questions.answer: It was a major ancient port for international trade.

questions.question: Which dynasty is linked with Ajanta cave paintings?
questions.answer: The Vakataka dynasty is linked with Ajanta caves.

questions.question: Which literary work was written by Pravarsen II?
questions.answer: Setubandh was written by Pravarsen II.

questions.question: Why is Kalidasa associated with the Vakataka period?
questions.answer: His work Meghadoot belongs to this period.

questions.question: What made Mahabalipuram an important Pallava center?
questions.answer: It was a major center of art and architecture.

questions.question: Which dynasty encouraged maritime trade with Southeast Asia?
questions.answer: The Pallava dynasty encouraged maritime trade.

questions.question: Why are Rashtrakutas known for cave architecture?
questions.answer: They built large monolithic rock-cut temples.

questions.question: Which dynasty dominated Karnataka after the Vakatakas?
questions.answer: The Chalukyas dominated Karnataka.

questions.question: Why is Aihole important in temple architecture?
questions.answer: It shows early experiments in temple construction.

questions.question: Which dynasty is associated with Pattadakal?
questions.answer: The Chalukya dynasty is associated with Pattadakal.

questions.question: Why is the Rashtrakuta dynasty historically significant?
questions.answer: It ruled a vast territory across India.

questions.question: What does this chapter reveal about South Indian kingdoms?
questions.answer: It shows political diversity and cultural richness.

questions.question: Why were trade routes important for ancient South Indian kingdoms?
questions.answer: They supported economic growth and overseas trade.

questions.question: How did patronage of art strengthen royal authority?
questions.answer: It enhanced prestige and cultural influence.

questions.question: How does this chapter help understand early South Indian history?
questions.answer: It explains the rise and contributions of major southern dynasties.

questions.question: Why are the Cher, Pandya and Chola kingdoms considered foundational to South Indian history?
questions.answer: They represent the earliest organized political powers described in Sangham literature.

questions.question: How did Sangham literature help historians reconstruct early South Indian society?
questions.answer: It provides details about rulers, economy, social life, and warfare.

questions.question: Why was overseas trade crucial for the Cher kingdom?
questions.answer: It brought wealth through ports like Muziris and connected them to foreign markets.

questions.question: How did pearl trade influence the power of the Pandya kingdom?
questions.answer: Pearl exports generated revenue and international recognition.

questions.question: Why did control over river valleys strengthen early Chola rule?
questions.answer: River valleys supported agriculture and population growth.

questions.question: How did the Satavahanas act as a link between North and South India?
questions.answer: They controlled trade routes connecting northern and southern regions.

questions.question: Why was Pratishthan strategically important for the Satavahanas?
questions.answer: It lay on major inland trade routes.

questions.question: How did Gautamiputra Satakarni consolidate Satavahana power?
questions.answer: By defeating Shaka rulers and restoring territorial control.

questions.question: Why is the title Tri-samudra-toya-peet-vahan historically significant?
questions.answer: It symbolized extensive territorial expansion.

questions.question: How does Gatha-Saptashati reflect social life of the Satavahana period?
questions.answer: It describes everyday emotions and rural life.

questions.question: Why was maritime imagery used on Satavahana coins?
questions.answer: To highlight the importance of sea trade.

questions.question: How did the rise of the Vakatakas change Deccan politics?
questions.answer: They replaced Satavahana authority with a new ruling power.

questions.question: Why was Ajanta an important center under the Vakatakas?
questions.answer: It flourished as a major artistic and religious site.

questions.question: How did Vakataka patronage contribute to Indian art?
questions.answer: It supported detailed mural paintings at Ajanta.

questions.question: Why is Kalidasa associated with cultural growth during this period?
questions.answer: His works reflect literary excellence of the age.

questions.question: How did the Chalukyas establish political dominance in the Deccan?
questions.answer: Through military strength and administrative control.

questions.question: Why was Vatapi chosen as the Chalukya capital?
questions.answer: It was well-protected by natural defenses.

questions.question: How did Pulakeshi II enhance Chalukya prestige?
questions.answer: By successfully resisting northern invasion.

questions.question: Why is Pattadakal important for understanding temple architecture?
questions.answer: It shows a blend of architectural styles.

questions.question: How did Pallava rule encourage artistic innovation?
questions.answer: Through patronage of rock-cut and structural temples.

questions.question: Why was Kanchipuram a powerful Pallava capital?
questions.answer: It was a political, religious, and cultural center.

questions.question: How did Mahendravarman contribute to Pallava culture?
questions.answer: He promoted literature and drama.

questions.question: Why is Mahabalipuram considered architecturally significant?
questions.answer: It contains monolithic ratha temples and reliefs.

questions.question: How did naval strength benefit the Pallava kingdom?
questions.answer: It enabled overseas trade and influence.

questions.question: Why was religious tolerance important under the Pallavas?
questions.answer: It ensured social harmony among diverse communities.

questions.question: How did the Rashtrakutas emerge as a pan-Indian power?
questions.answer: By controlling large territories across regions.

questions.question: Why was Ellora significant during Rashtrakuta rule?
questions.answer: It became a center of monumental rock-cut architecture.

questions.question: How does the Kailas temple demonstrate engineering excellence?
questions.answer: It was carved entirely from a single rock.

questions.question: Why did Rashtrakuta patronage strengthen cultural unity?
questions.answer: It supported art and religion across regions.

questions.question: How did geography influence the rise of Deccan kingdoms?
questions.answer: Plateaus and passes shaped trade and defense.

questions.question: Why were trade routes essential for political stability?
questions.answer: They generated revenue for administration.

questions.question: How did temple building serve political purposes?
questions.answer: It symbolized royal power and devotion.

questions.question: Why is South India described as culturally diverse in this chapter?
questions.answer: Multiple dynasties promoted varied traditions.

questions.question: How did foreign trade influence local economies?
questions.answer: It increased wealth and urban development.

questions.question: Why is this period important for understanding regional kingdoms?
questions.answer: It marks the rise of independent southern powers.

questions.question: How did inscriptions and coins help legitimize rulers?
questions.answer: They recorded achievements and authority.

questions.question: Why was art patronage a common feature among southern dynasties?
questions.answer: It enhanced prestige and cultural legacy.

questions.question: How does the chapter show continuity despite political change?
questions.answer: Cultural practices continued across dynasties.

questions.question: Why were ports vital to South Indian kingdoms?
questions.answer: They connected India with overseas markets.

questions.question: How did religious architecture reflect royal ideology?
questions.answer: It displayed devotion and authority.

questions.question: Why is the Deccan considered a bridge between North and South India?
questions.answer: It linked political and trade networks.

questions.question: How did dynastic rivalries shape South Indian history?
questions.answer: They influenced territorial expansion and alliances.

questions.question: Why is the study of multiple dynasties necessary for this period?
questions.answer: No single power dominated permanently.

questions.question: How does this chapter highlight the role of geography in history?
questions.answer: It explains how terrain affected politics and trade.

questions.question: Why did South Indian kingdoms focus on maritime strength?
questions.answer: To support overseas trade and influence.

questions.question: How did cultural achievements strengthen royal legitimacy?
questions.answer: They earned respect and loyalty of subjects.

questions.question: Why is temple architecture a key historical source?
questions.answer: It preserves artistic and religious values.

questions.question: How does this chapter explain interaction between regions?
questions.answer: Through trade, warfare, and cultural exchange.

questions.question: Why is the study of ancient South Indian kingdoms essential?
questions.answer: It reveals regional contributions to Indian civilization.

questions.question: How does this chapter contribute to understanding Indian history as a whole?
questions.answer: It integrates southern developments into the national narrative.
